intro: Schmidelia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in woodland edges. Schmidelia velutina is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various conditions.
